text: The Popular Action of Equatorial Guinea () is a political party in the Equatorial Guinea. It is led by Carmelo Mba Bacalé. It is currently one of many opposition parties in the country banned by the ruling party, the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea, the ruling party since 1979. Despite being an illegal party, Bacalé gained 0.16% of the country's vote for the AP in the 2009 Equatoguinean presidential election. ==References== Category:Banned political parties Category:Political parties in Equatorial Guinea Category:Political parties established in 1990 Category:Christian democratic parties in Africa
title: Popular Action of Equatorial Guinea
